Major General Herbert Darque [Documents pertaining to Air Force Air Defense System Testing; Containing maps, diagrams, and photographs [some originals with copies]; Front and back of pages number a total of 25 [missing pages 1/2 and 21/22]
Note[PDF]: Page 3: Plate 1. Area covered by test and course information must follow to make interception possible.
Note[PDF]: Page 4: 8. Sighting the plane.-The plane, if approaching overland, is first sighted by one of hundreds of civilian observers spotted five to eight miles apart throughout the test sector

Note[PDF]: Page 5: Plate 2. Observation Post at Sands Point Club, Long Island (Courtesy of Life); Plate 3. Chart of two toll centers, showing lines of flow of messages through local switch-boards[Original page and plates attached]

Note[PDF]: Page 6: 11. Filter board plotting.- The "raw" information from the observer is received by a "plotter" sitting at the filter board. The plotter, a woman volunteer, has individual mouthpiece and earphones[Original page and plate from page attached]
Note[PDF]: Page 7: Plate 5. Old Filter Board, New York Information Center. [Original plate attached]

Note[PDF]: Page 8: 12. Interpretation.- A filterer standing behind the plotter waits until three or more reports have been received. Discrepancies as to fact are eliminated by weeding out details which vary from the bulk fo the reports on any item...

Note[PDF]: Page 8: 12. Interpretation.- A filterer standing behind the plotter waits until three or more reports have been received. Discrepancies as to fact are eliminated by weeding out details which vary from the bulk fo the reports on any item[Orginal plate from page attached]

Note[PDF]: Page 9: 14. Transmission.- On a balcony overlooking the filter board are tellers, one for each toll center show on the board. Each has a telephone headset and can see clearly each move on the board[Original plate from page attached]

Note[PDF]: Verso: Page 10: 17. Decision.- On a mezzanine balcony overlooking the operations board are the controller, who acts for or is commanding officer for the region[Original plate from page attached]
Note[PDF]: Page 11: Plate 9. Diagramatic cut out of new Information Center in New York
Note[PDF]: Verso: Page 12: Plate 10. New Operations board, status board and seaward board in New York Center. [Original plate attached]

Note[PDF]: Page 13: 18. Intercept orders.- Upon ascertaining the strength, location, direction and speed of an enemy flight in his region the controller orders into the air from the most logical airdrome in his region pursuit of sufficient strength to effect the interception...[Orginal plate from page attached]

Note[PDF]: Verso: Page 14: by taking over the task of navigation for them. Intercept tellers are designated to relay to the intercept officer the military intelligence displayed upon the filter boards

Note[PDF]: Page 15: more time than the fuel capacity of the pursuit would permit. The pursuit therefore attempts to effect interception on a course as nearly head-on as possible[Orginal plates from page attached]

Note[PDF]: Verso: Page 16: 26. The Command Post.- At the New York Information Center is a command post for the Commanding General, First Interceptor Command. At this command post is an operations board[Original plate from page attached]
Note[PDF]: Page 17: Plate 15. Diagram of Command, First Interceptor Command. As indicated, the same general organization exists in the 2nd, 3rd and 4th. [Original plate attached]

Note[PDF]: Verso: Page 18: Section III; The Mechanics of the System; 29. Use of the Telephone System.- The existence of the American Telephone and Telegraph Company, with its network of local and long lines which have no parallel in anywhere else in the world
Note[PDF]: Page 19: Plate 17. Discs placed on map for selection of observation posts after marking of telephones [Orginal plate attached]

Note[PDF]: Verso: Page 20: showing the flow of telephon traffic. The "ridge-lines" on the telephone mape deterine the extant boundary. 34. Filter areas.- In each region two or more filter areas were set up to prevent overloading of any one filter board with messages...[Original plate from page attached]
Note[PDF]: Page 23: Plate 19. Pursuit Officer on balcony of old New York Information Center.; Plate 20. Radio officer on balcony of old New York Information Center. [Orginal plates attached]

Note[PDF]: Verso: Page 24: Personnel in Test; 39. Participating Units.- Units and organization participating in the test will include the following: a. Civilians (1) Forty thousand observers at 1800 observation posts, supplied by State Defense Councils

Note[PDF]: Page 25: f. Coast Artillery. (1) 369th A. A. Regiment, Boston, Mass. (2) Provisional Brigade of A. A. consisting of the 62nd C. A., 71st C. A., and 122nd C. A. Battalion of New York[Original plate from page attached]
